meanings.definition: A thin mortar used to fill the gaps between tiles.
meanings.sent1: The handyman applied grout between the tiles to keep them in place.
meanings.sent2: The bathroom floor needed grout to seal the spaces between the ceramic tiles.
meanings.sent3: Why did the grout refuse to stay between the tiles? It wanted to explore the world beyond!
meanings.sent4: The grout, like a loyal friend, held the tiles together through thick and thin.
meanings.sent5: The grout, resembling a white river flowing between the tiles, added a clean finish to the floor.

meanings.definition: To fill or repair with grout.
meanings.sent1: She grouted the cracks in the wall to prevent water leakage.
meanings.sent2: The contractor will grout the tiles after they are securely in place.
meanings.sent3: When the cat knocked over the vase, she grouted the pieces back together.
meanings.sent4: His words grouted a sense of hope in her heart, filling the void with positivity.
meanings.sent5: The artist grouted the mosaic with precision, creating a masterpiece on the wall.
